intro: Labordia molokaiana var. munroi, commonly known as the Molokaʻi hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native habitat. It features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
